text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen now I'm 
pretty sure most of you know what a Tom Yum soup

is it's one of Thailand's most popular dishes 
now there are hundreds of variations of Tom Yum

I already have two on my website today I'm adding 
a third I am making Tom Yum hed mangsawirat now

hed is mushrooms and mangsawirat is vegetarian 
or vegan and when I developed this recipe it

turned out to be a bit more of a challenge than 
I thought it would be because traditional Tom

Yum relies so heavily on the flavor of fish sauce 
and also animal-based broth so after a few trials

and error I finally arrived at this recipe which 
I have to say is phenomenal I'm a meat-eater and

I loved it so if you're vegetarian or vegan or 
you've got friends who is vegetarian or vegan

this is the recipe that will satisfy everybody so 
let's get started I'm going to start with making

the vegetable stock that we're going to use as 
a base for the soup okay so I've got here some

daikon radish which is very commonly used in 
a Thai broth or stock I've got some onion I've

got some cilantro roots which I have smashed 
and I've also got some cracked white pepper

right here and some smashed garlic one of the 
versions that I made I put carrots in my stock

and it just takes it too much like carrots so 
all the vegetables were using here it's mild

enough that it's going to give off a nice flavor 
that won't be overpowering and do not be tempted

to just use water for this okay I've done it and 
it is highly highly disappointing it's a brothy

soup so if you just use water the flavor will be 
so weak I mean if you are making like a creamy

soup that's vegan you can get away with water as a 
liquid but not in this case okay so we're going to

let this go for about an hour so the herbs we are 
using are the same what I call thumb yum Trinity

we've got some lemongrass and I'm using quite 
a bit because in thumb yum I do want the flavor

for the lemongrass to lead and all you do is just 
smash the lemongrass with something heavy you can

use the back of your knife and then just cut them 
into big chunks okay and I only use the bottom

half because that's where the flavour is most 
concentrated that's our path I say for stock and

tea and things like that I've got some galangal 
and today I've got a whole one to show you it

looks kind of like this you don't need to peel 
it you just need to slice it up into thin rounds

and the last of the Trinity kaffir lime leaves 
wonderful citrusy aroma so important in this

dish they also sell these dry or frozen by the 
way so you might want to check those departments

for this I am adding some grilled shallot so these 
are just shallots that I I shouldn't say grilled

broiled so I just put them under the broiler 
in the oven for a few minutes into their chart

and I think it's important for a vegetarian 
thumb yum because it really does add a little

extra smokiness and body and richness to the broth 
mushroom so you can use whatever kind of mushrooms

you like although i stick with asian mushrooms you 
know just keeping with the theme here so I've got

some oyster mushrooms here which I love for thumb 
yum soup and I've also got some enoki mushrooms

here and these are really popular in Asia for hot 
pots and soups and I like them here because they

look kind of like noodles in the soup at the end 
and then some fresh shiitake mushrooms that I've

sliced the only mushrooms I will suggest you don't 
use is the button mushrooms they just they're not

great in soups they're kind of spongy and they 
they don't really integrate into the soup so

you know skip save those for something else all 
right let's get cookin all right so here's our

vegetable stock it smells fantastic smells very 
Thai I fished out all the vegetables with just a

mesh skimmer and you should have about three cups 
at this point if you don't add a little more water

if you have too much just let it reduce a little 
more no big deal okay so now I'm going to switch

pot this is my soup pot I'm going to turn on the 
heat just on you know medium and then I'm going to

add a little bit of oil and now to this oil I'm 
going to add some chili flakes that's right you

can use whatever kind of chili flakes you want 
the chili flakes will infuse into the oil and

then it'll give a nice red color another reason 
why I'm adding a little oil is because without

the bone broth this soup is entirely lene there's 
zero drop of fat in it and it's not quite as nice

in terms of mouthfeel and richness when it's too 
mean like that okay so now it's a little toasty

the oil is nice and red I'm going to go in with 
my bra and you can see already how that chili

oil is making that broth look nice otherwise it 
would just look like plain broth it's not as nice

okay so all the herbs are going to go in so the 
kaffir lime leaves you want to make sure you give

it a some tough rough love before you throw it 
in so really twist and Bruce it it'll just help

the flavors come out a little better all these 
herbs that I just put in you're not supposed to

eat okay that's just for infusion purposes only 
the shallots though we're going to leave them in

there because you can eat those they become really 
sweet and they only need to simmer over for about

three minutes it's not like a cinnamon stick that 
takes a long time it's very quick okay oh wow this

is boiling I'll tell you about something I forgot 
to tell you about earlier if you like something

crunchy in your soup try looking for these black 
fungus mush I know that does not sound appetizing

at all but they're sometimes called black fungus 
cloud ear mushroom there's like a few other names

I don't remember right now but these are dried and 
they're quite widely available at Chinese grocery

stores and you soak these in water just in hot 
water a room-temperature water or hot water would

be faster and they don't have much of a flavor 
but they've got this nice crunch to it and then

you can add this to your soup as well so that's an 
option if you want we can really smell the herbs

in the air and the chilies are also in the air 
there's a bit of coughing going on that's what

happens when you're in hot Thai Kitchen alright 
I'm going to add the mushrooms if you want to

remove some of the herbs now do it now okay throw 
away your herbs all right so all the mushrooms

are going in and all of these only take one minute 
to cook ooh that looks pretty I'm going to season

this normally I use fish sauce but of course we're 
instead going to use soy sauce and this is Thai

mushroom soy sauce but if you want you can just 
use regular soy sauce just a little bit of sugar

just to balance out that's salt so we'll just 
bring this to a boil alright the soup is boiling

the Mai to cook through I'm going to turn this off 
now and then I'm going to throw in some Tomatoes

and I'm using cherry tomatoes you can use large 
Tomatoes and then just cut them into small wedges

and I throw them in sort of at the end because I 
don't want them to be mushy and then you know the

skin starts floating off of the tomato but the 
tomatoes especially when they're ripe and sweet

like these will add that sort of burst of juicy 
fruitiness that works really really well infimum

my lime juice the most important seasoning fresh 
fresh fresh always don't use bottled lime juice

please whenever you make soup you always want 
to taste and adjust the seasoning because you

don't know how much things have evaporated and 
all that stuff oh oh that's good like I surprise

myself every to taste it that just looks so good 
little cilantro chopped cilantro if you want you

can also do sawtooth coriander we do that a lot 
in thumb as well or if you if you're one of those

cilantro haters you don't have to put any in mmm 
and we're dark as a meat-eater I would never have

guessed this was vegan so if you've got friends 
who think of vegan foods gross whatever you feed

them this and it'll change your mind forever 
they've completely lost their right to say

anything bad about vegan food it's so flavorful 
all the herbs really come out it start from that

lime juice but well balanced by both the little 
bit of sugar and the sweetness of the tomatoes and

also just a natural sweetness of the vegetables 
that we used in the stalks and this is why it's so

important did you use a good vegetable stock all 
that natural sweetness really gives us some body

and some richness but at the same time it's really 
the light and so refreshing oh my god so good so I

hope you give this a try the recipe as always is 
on hot hi calm when you make it send me a photo

on Facebook Twitter and Instagram and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
